name: places/ChIJa2YT-ahZwokR-FABvLXcKi0
formattedAddress: 11 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 11 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Asian eats from noodles to spicy fried chicken can be had at this multi-level food court.

originalText.text: The food is amazing in whatever store you decide to order from in the court, my go to is always a poke bowl. Their karaoke rooms are great as well with the "disco lights" and everything. The machine is easy to use and you can always ask for help easily. The staff is really nice!

text.text: The food is amazing in whatever store you decide to order from in the court, my go to is always a poke bowl. Their karaoke rooms are great as well with the "disco lights" and everything. The machine is easy to use and you can always ask for help easily. The staff is really nice!

originalText.text: A MUST IN KOREATOWN! Gives the experience of a food court in Asia üåè üòã  There are 2 floors and a karaoke above with a small photo booth. The 1st floor has most of the food vendors. Try the Chinese pancakes! Soups are awesome üëå üëè

text.text: A MUST IN KOREATOWN! Gives the experience of a food court in Asia üåè üòã  There are 2 floors and a karaoke above with a small photo booth. The 1st floor has most of the food vendors. Try the Chinese pancakes! Soups are awesome üëå üëè

originalText.text: Loads of options to choose from, mostly traditional Korean and Japanese foods. I recommend the pork katsu with omlete rice. Seating can be found on all 3 floors so good luck finding a table on busier days. Before you leave make sure to try the pork buns or red bean/choco filled fish shaped pastries (Taiyaki) to-go with a large coco cream wow bubble tea from Kung fu!

text.text: Loads of options to choose from, mostly traditional Korean and Japanese foods. I recommend the pork katsu with omlete rice. Seating can be found on all 3 floors so good luck finding a table on busier days. Before you leave make sure to try the pork buns or red bean/choco filled fish shaped pastries (Taiyaki) to-go with a large coco cream wow bubble tea from Kung fu!

originalText.text: This place is always bustling with people and I love coming here whenever I visit the city. There are many different asian options from snacks to full course meals. They have very reasonable prices and the food is very delicious. Sometimes however, it may be very difficult to find a place to sit because there are so many people.

text.text: This place is always bustling with people and I love coming here whenever I visit the city. There are many different asian options from snacks to full course meals. They have very reasonable prices and the food is very delicious. Sometimes however, it may be very difficult to find a place to sit because there are so many people.

originalText.text:
Omg!!! I had a good time. I'm a regular visitor in koreantown but I'm embarrassed that I only discovered this place recently. Since it's literally close to my regular eateries.
I stared off with the original  korean hotdog which contained sausage and mozzarella cheese. Best decision!! It was so scrumptious I would have ditched on the other dishes but I had a plan. Next up, I ordered the marinated beef pocket buns and kimchi bun and was disappointed. Recently tried bao buns (pecking duck) for the first time and have been craving it so I was excited but that wasn't the case for either buns. I would admit I took a little while before eating it but the temperature wasn't the main problem. The kimchi bun was ...un-kimchi like tasting and soggy and the other literally fell apart. The onnly thing I enjoyed was the Shredded veggie on the pocket bun.
I went ahead to order a bowl of cheese tteokbokki and sotteok sotteok (sausage rice cake skewer) I've wanted to try for so long and a winter melon green tea. I enjoyed them all.
On the third floor I discovered the photo booth and had a good time for a first timer. The vibe on the third floor is different from the others.  I got to enjoy my taro ice-cream (another first time experience) on the third floor while enjoying the gloomy view. Definitely coming back... soon! Got more cravings to satiate and more pic to take.
Edit: I went 3 days in a row since I had so many things to try and craved. I missed out on the k-hotdog on the 2nd day but I got the custard cream  fish shaped pastry  and the everything kimbab.  Damn the kimbab was SOO good (craving it rn) meanwhilethe pastry was alright. On the third day, I tried the potato and cheetos khotdogs and they didn't hit the spot like the first time. It was super greasy. Probably should have let it cool more. After that I tried the spicy noodles and beef platter alongside a taro slush. Taro is definitely a flavor that is growing on me. Overall I had an okay time. Nothing beats first moments.
